structure.unit: Regulation Of Trade And Certain Enterprises

law.catch_line: Introducing False Information Into Reporting Agency’S Files; Penalty
law.text: Any person who is convicted of knowingly and willfully introducing, attempting to introduce or causing to be introduced, false information into a consumer reporting agency’s files for the purpose of damaging or enhancing the credit information of any individual shall be punished by a fine of not more than five thousand dollars or by imprisonment for not more than one year, or both.
